results.title: Apollo 11: one giant leap for mankind
results.brief_description: Follows the flight of Apollo 11 to the Moon and back, showing the launching and each stage of the operation with views and comments of the astronauts, their activities on the surface and return trip to President Nixon’s welcome No other credits available

results.title: Apollo 10: prelude to the moon landing
results.brief_description: Depicts the “dress rehearsal” of the Apollo 11 flight with astronauts Stafford, Young and Cernan. This mission supplied information to assist the Apollo 11 moon landing and the film contains the first colour television shot in space and shows the spacecraft nine miles from the lunar surface.

results.title: Apollo 10: around the moon
results.creator_credit: United States. National Aeronautics Space Administration
results.brief_description: The film shows various footage of Apollo 10’s travel around the moon including: the Command module filmed from the Lunar module; the far side of the moon; Command module over landing site No. 2; view from Lunar module sixty miles up; inside the Lunar module; Lunar module descent and much more.

results.title: Apollo 1
results.creator_credit: Clavius Base, Imagine Entertainment (US), Brian Grazer, Ron Howard, Michael Bostick and David Frankel
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “From the earth to the moon”.
January 27, 1967. In preparation for the flight of Apollo 1, astronauts Gus Grissom, Ed White and Roger Chaffe undergo a routine test in their space capsule. The test turns into a disaster when a small electrical fire becomes a raging inferno - the lives of three men lost before they even leave the ground. The nation mourns, but the ever-watchful Senate Committee - anxious over the extreme haste and massive expenditure involved in the project thus far - may pull the plug on the entire Apollo project.

results.title: Apocalypse now: redux [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Omni Zoetrope and Francis Ford Coppola
results.brief_description: A stunning vision of man’s heart of darkness, revealed through the particular madness of the Vietnam War. Lieutenant Willard receives orders to seek out the renegade Colonel Kurtz, who has disappeared into the depths of the jungle. Willard’s mission becomes an epic journey into his own soul and that of the mysterious Kurtz. The trails of making this film are well documented, particularly within “Hearts of darkness: a filmmaker’s apocalypse” (1991) - Coppola’s financial, casting and location woes complicated his desire to deliver an anti-war work that would find an audience. In 2000 he began working on restoring key scenes, deleted in 1979, identifying those that expounded upon his themes of military madness and moral degradation. New scenes include: Willard’s seduction by a widow after attending a dinner at the home of a French plantation owner, the sumptuousness of which speaks of yearning for an idealised past and reflects Willard’s retreat from the present; the Playboy bunnies become stranded and Willard’s crew offer them fuel in exchange for sex, compounding the sense of the military’s ethical deprivation; Kurtz extrapolates upon the insanity of war, a philosophical scene linked to the denouement. Coppola’s original work won numerous accolades, but many critics questioned the rationale behind “Redux” and theorised that it perhaps reflected his failure to produce engaging work throughout the 1990s.

results.title: Apocalypse now
results.creator_credit: Francis Ford Coppola and Omni Zoetrope
results.brief_description: Francis Ford Coppola’s stunning vision of man’s heart of darkness, revealed through the particular madness of the Vietnam War. Lieutenant Willard (Martin Sheen) receives orders to seek out the renegade Colonel Kurtz (Marlon Brando) who has disappeared into the depths of the jungle. Willard’s mission becomes an epic journey into his own soul and that of the mysterious Kurtz. Based on the novella by Joseph Conrad, “Heart of Darkness”. Original music by Carmine Coppola, Francis Ford Coppola, Mickey Hart.

results.title: Aplekage: the art of Stewart Merrett
results.creator_credit: Andromeda Productions, Dunkirk Traders, Trevor George Lucas and Russell Hurley
results.brief_description: Stewart Merrett works in a fabric art form that is colourful, understandable and very popular. He likes to think that people who call themselves artists can actually draw, that they have some intrinsic craft.

results.title: Aphids
results.creator_credit: ERPI Classroom Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Deals with periods in the life-history of the common plant louse; close-ups show the insect laying eggs, moulting and feeding. A time-lapse study is used to show wing development; microcinematography shows details of the insect’s beck.
